result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Christine A. Thornton. Defendant Christine A. Thornton in court, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. DE has been accepted into the vivitrol program and is set to get her first shot tomorrow. Court amends bond to $20,000 signature bond with same conditions. DE cannot sign the bond until she is set to be taken to get her shot.
Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Christine A. Thornton. Defendant Christine A. Thornton appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. This matter is set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Christine A. Thornton appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
